meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be wetted.
meanings.sent1: The wettabilities of the fabric allowed the water to spread evenly.
meanings.sent2: The wettabilities of the surface determined how quickly the spilled liquid would be absorbed.
meanings.sent3: The wettabilities of the sponge made it the envy of all the other cleaning tools.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for gardening had the wettabilities of a rain-soaked flower, always ready to absorb new knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The wettabilities of the paper were so high that even a tiny drop of water caused it to crinkle instantly.

meanings.definition: The degree to which a surface can be wetted by a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The wettabilities of the glass made it perfect for serving cold drinks.
meanings.sent2: Scientists measured the wettabilities of different materials to understand their water resistance.
meanings.sent3: The wettabilities of the umbrella were so impressive that even the heaviest rain couldn't make it soggy.
meanings.sent4: His charm had the wettabilities of a magnet, attracting attention wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The wettabilities of the soil were so high that the raindrops disappeared into it as if by magic.
